Description: Drill-bit of hard crystalline sandstone: with concave depressions on the sides for attachment to the shaft of the drill. Bears concentric circular marks from use, on both top and bottom, showing that the bit was used both ways up.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: W. M. F. Petrie, 'Abydos' I (London, 1902), 25-6 and pl.LIII, 32 (probably). Compare Petrie, W. M. F. Petrie, 'Abydos' I (London, 1902), pl. LIII, 26-31, 33; B. Adams, 'Ancient Hierakonpolis' (Warminster, 1974), 39, nos. 194-6 and pl.28; J. E. Quibell & F. W. Green, 'Hierakonpolis' II (London, 1989), pl.LXII, 3-6; C. M. Firth and J. E. Quibell, 'Excavations at Saqqara : the Step Pyramid' II (Cairo, 1935), pl.93, (6); J. E. Quibell, ‘Archaic Objects’ (Cairo, 1905), nos. 14679-80 and pl.LXIII; T. C. Currelly, 'Stone Implements' (Cairo, 1913), nos. 64645-6 and pl.XLIII; H. Bonnet, 'Ein frühgeschichtliches Gräberfeld bei Abusir' (Leipzeig, 1928) , 12, abb. 9; A. Scharff, ‘Die Altertümer der Vor – und Frühzeit Ägyptens’ I (Berlin, 1929-31), no. 118 and pl.6.
